website_summaries.verdict: The Amazon Show Mode Charging Dock is a smart, convenient way to get double duty from your Fire tablet while keeping it charged, too.
pros: The Amazon Show Mode Charging Dock is a docking station that turns a current Fire HD 8 or HD 10 into an Echo Show
It includes a slim case and charges your tablet
cons: The case is pretty simple and doesn't have a premium look or feel
It costs more than it should

customer_reviews.title: Does not support “Drop In” from other echos.
customer_reviews.text: It’s good at what it does. The Alexa commands were responsive. I could call out on it as well asDrop In to other Echo devices. BUT I bought it to be able to use Drop In into it from my other Echos and it does not support that. That is a show stopper as my user story has not been met. So returning the show mode dock and the Fire HD tablet. Should not advertise that it can do what the Amazon Echo Show can do if it won’t support Drop In inbound. Wish it would have worked as I am a big Alexa fan and use it through out my house for lights, air conditioning, music, intercom, cameras, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kellenberger

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: This product is not needed. It is just a big rip off. I watch movies all the time while my kindle is in its case the only difference is that the 1/4 inch around the cover takes a tiny bit away from the movie. I have my kindle in a case so everytime I want to use this device I have to remove the cover and get the other things all set up which is not needed. The charging elament won't stand up so it is just a big waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Delighted, then Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in August. The deadline to return was September 26th, and it quit working on October 5th. It will not even charge the tablet now. I was really hoping this would be a good way to get more use out of my fire, now, all I have is a useless piece of plastic. I do not know if mine was defective from the start and I did not realize it, if it developed a problem or if others we have the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Too Flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product four days and plan to give it to someone with no kids, no pets, no hard floors and who can stand directly in front of it and shout, "Alexa!" The user needs patience to remove it from the dock daily or else leave it on a wide table near a plug. The slightest movement could topple it over and there is no room to cover it with a protective case. I will return my Kindle to its secure case, prop it up, and get the same result. For some reason I thought this would enhance my "Show Mode" experience, which I rarely use because of its limited capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Reader

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Charge Connection, Doesn't Work! Horrible Design
customer_reviews.text: This item has so many bad design approaches. 1. It's contacts for charging, though are touching metal to metal, don't work. I have to unplug the case and replug for it to charge. 2. It doesn't even have a vertical stand and charge mode. 3. The case should not just be for the show dock, but should also provide protection from falling. Since the case doesn't allow for another protective case to go over it, it should at least serve a 2-in-1 purpose. RETURNED.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Good...couple of steps shy of being great
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, wireless charging is great. Turns my HD8 into a nice bedside alarm clock on steroids. A couple of hopes for future updates: 1) A way to have the blue shade feature shut off automatically if docked. I use my HD8 to read at night and love the blue shade function, but when docked it makes the Show Mode too bright and unreadable. It would be great if docking the tablet switched it automatically to regular color mode. 2) A way to turn off the docked/undocked chime sound effect without turning off all system sounds. At night it’s rather loud when your partner is asleep next to you.
customer_reviews.author: Less Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Useless unless you use their cover
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this unless you only plan to use the Fire inside your house. It only charges and goes into show mode if you use the included cover and has a fragile connector frome the cover to the fire...that is troublesome to remove if you wish to charge via usb. If you use any other cover it will only get in the way and not charge.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Make's the Tablet show-like for about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: After 30 minutes it no longer retains the SHOW function even when I have the screen set to not time out. I thought it would turn the tablet in to a decent show clone, but it doesnt even keep it in show mode while docked as it says it will. Once I wake the tablet back up from a sleep it shouldnt even be in it Have to either pick it up off the base and put it back down to start show mode again or do it manually through the tablet. You're better off just buying a Cheap-O cover and keep it plugged in and save yourself 30-40 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Loosearrow

customer_reviews.title: Show mode is good
customer_reviews.text: So far it's okay. The dock or HD8 keeps making a "clicking/tapping" sound every now and then. Not sure what it's doing. Otherwise it works good and still getting used to it. Price is good for what you are getting. Wish the sound was a little better. The Dot sounds better for sure. We use it more for on our kitchen counter to see weather, cameras, timer, etc. Works great for that.
customer_reviews.author: WiredMAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice, very convenient to bedside table!
customer_reviews.text: the dock is awesome; my kindle appears to be charging better than before and the charge seems to be lasting longer, as well. I love that I've been able to get rid of my alarm clock complete, as having my dock next to the bed allows me to just set an alarm, play soothing music, anything I need to get a good night's sleep and get up on time. My only recommendation is to make some upgrades to the Alexa program itself. I find it hilarious that Alexa always displays "Good Morning!" regardless of what time of day it is. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dannaher

customer_reviews.title: Time tells all....
customer_reviews.text: I've had my charging dock for some time now and all has been just fine. I would have given a 5 star review but time tells. The dock is now very quirky about when it decides to charge or not. Even when it says it's charging it's not. At other times it charges like crazy making my Fire Tablet very hot. If I strip off the stand and go back to normal charging everything is just fine. So now I have a very expensive plastic stand that does noting but hold up my Fire Tablet. Amazon owes me!
customer_reviews.author: H. Fites

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: After using for 5 months it stopped working. My Fire table is updated. All the plugs have been checked. It is probably docked. And it still will not come on. I guess it was nice while it lasted. And of course this is way it is only guarantee for 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A.

customer_reviews.title: NOT a Wireless charger
customer_reviews.text: I admit, I did not research this properly before purchasing. I expected this to be a wireless dock, like a smart phone dock. It is not. It comes with a bulky "case" that you put your Fire into that adapts the charging port to a pair of contacts on the back of the case. The assembly then is placed in the charging dock. The case is somewhat bulky and awkward and hard plastic. It doesn't seem that it would cushion the Fire if dropped and makes it less "user friendly" to hold. Not terrible-just know what to expect. I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: BrianD

customer_reviews.title: I do like the Kindle docking station I don’t like the fact ...
customer_reviews.text: I do like the Kindle docking station I don’t like the fact that I had to take my existing cover off my Kindle because now there’s really no protector on it and I keep it on the stand it would be nice to have the option to either flip the cover over and or keep it on the stand
customer_reviews.author: Salisbury's

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: Dock works as described with my Fire HD10 tablet. The show mode update, however, does not seem to replicate on the tablet all the functions of my Echo Show, I.e. some enabled skills. Of course the tablet speaker sucks so I have a 3.5mm cable hooked up from the tablet to my VaVa Voom speaker, which I leave plugged into an outlet and turned on. The dock is convenient but needs to be a little less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: rgerson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate this product for the ability to easily dock/charge/and display the clock and or photos. Its also ideal for adults who use their fire tables without a case but want a simple way to charge that doesn't require using a normal charging cable into the Amazon Fire Tablets inferior/high defective charging port. The Docks charging system puts much less strain on the charging port and will certainly length the life of the fire. Only reviewed it 4 stars because they should really listen to this SUGGESTION TO AMAZON, MAKE A KID SAFE CASE WITH THE SAME ABILITY YOU WOULD SELL A TON!
customer_reviews.author: badbryan21

customer_reviews.title: Just...don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This turns into an expensive, not very user-friendly stand after a few months. I've had two of these and each just randomly stopped charging. I was lucky to get a replacement for free the first time, despite being outside of the "return window" but the second go-round, I won't waste my time trying. Pros: - It is a decent stand - Makes it somewhat easy to dock (if charging) - Firm mini USB port Cons: - Slips off magnets too easily - Unintuitive design makes it a slight pain to move around - Will stop charging/working - The back case is very slick - no grip whatsoever - Uses mini USB port
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do much
customer_reviews.text: For a supposed media player dock, the volume output is considerably low, which is especially lame when using timers or alarms. The Show Mode (whatever that is) is slow to respond. I've tried to interact verbally to get what I want, like a cookie recipe, but it's honestly quicker to pick the damn thing up off the cradle, find what I want manually, and re-dock. One last jab - I haven't found a brand of Bluetooth headphones that work with the Fire HD tablet. So with low volume output, clunky interface and pointless design, I'm not sure why I bought this dock. It doesn't improve anything.
customer_reviews.author: Viewfinder79

customer_reviews.title: Makes charging easy.
customer_reviews.text: After reading quite a few reviews about the charging port failing, I used to cringe when I plugged in/unplugged my tablet. I saw this one day (never knew it existed) and ordered it immediately. I like that I can set the tablet in the dock, the magnets center it, I hear a beep and the battery icon shows that it's charging. I do like to leave the weather app on, when it's docked. I will update this, if it dies. if I have not, it's still working... If this review was helpful, please click 'Helpful' below (lets me know that I'm not wasting my time, by doing these). Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: John Mathers

customer_reviews.title: The tablet and charging station do not work
customer_reviews.text: The tablet and charging station no longer work.. It will not turn on at all, even when charged. I tried unsuccessfully to phone my problem to Amazon. I have been looking online for a way to contact Amazon about this problem and have not been successful. This makes it frustrating for me for the past three weeks. I would like to see a customer service phone number available under my account settings, so I can at least report this problem. I have never had a computer die so quickly, and never been so frustrated trying to figure out how to report the problem. Thank you, I really like Amazon and have never had a problem like this.
customer_reviews.author: vannatter

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, it's a over priced stand.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I can find to like about this docking station. A complete waste of money. Its a lot easier to just plug in your kindle as always. You can set your kindle on any stand. I tried to cancel the order before it was even sent, I was told I couldn't . I would have returned it but the charge for shipping and handling didn'tseem worth it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I have the stand plugged it to an outlet with power, the tablet is in the case, the white usb-plug-in is in, the case is on the magnetic connections, the software is up-to-date and it is not charging. Either the product is defective or it is ridiculously more complicated than a power charging station should be - either way: one-star, would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Toccoa

customer_reviews.title: loved it then it stopped charging after a few months.  Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped charging after a few months...right after return window closed. Purchased to easy charge a child's kindle. Now I just have an expensive stand. VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: One Chicken Farm

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't want to move it AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Very nice if you just want to plug it in and leave it where it is at - very touching if moving it even a little bit - it needs to have a magnet to keep it on the stand which the model doesn't have. You also have to change settings back when you remove it from the stand to get it out of "view" mode. It should know when you aren't charging it in the base that it isn't in view mode anymore. That must be a software issue. But over all a great product. I am just really picky about how i use things and the less you have to mess with it the more i like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with newer HD10
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT fit the new HD10 tablet, and it does not really say this anywhere. Had to return it unused. I do not see anything available for the new one (9th gen?) The main difference being the new charging port - no longer micro USB. Hopefully this saves someone else the hassle. A disclosure somewhere would have been nice (I looked before ordering but found no definitive answer)
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but you may want to wait for version 2.0
customer_reviews.text: So, overall I like the idea, but the execution is not great. The price seemed a bit high. My biggest problem is the case material is very slippery. I still use this to read and it has slipped right out of my hands. I will also sometimes prop it up on a pillow to read and that is no longer possible. Another issues is placing it back on the stand. It is usually dark and placing it back on the stand is not as idiot proof as I would like. It has to be put on relatively precisely. If not, it won't charge, or crashes to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Bower

customer_reviews.title: Show mode charging Dock
customer_reviews.text: I do have a problem with this product. When I have it in the charge mode I can't swipe from the bottom to choose my app. The only way I can get to my apps is to swipe from top and start FB then cancel that and go to apps. It works fine if I take it off charger. It is nice that I don't have to hold the Kindle while I use it. I was also hoping that I could use this to charge another fire HD 10 I damaged the plug on the Kindle. I broke one of the prongs off.
customer_reviews.author: marine

customer_reviews.title: Great Echo Show Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I like that I get video with news. The Fire HD 10 has an excellent display. The Echo Show only has a 7 inch display. The Fire HD 10 microphone occasionally doesn't respond to my request but then my other Echo devices don't either. I was disappointed that there isn't a follow-up mode setting for the Show mode but maybe it can be added in the near future. I use an external speaker since the HD10 speakers aren't that great. The Fire HD10 with the Show Mode Charging Dock is a great alternative to the Echo Show.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Room for Improvement
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great concept, but it is not yet there. Suggestions: make the tablet - docking station connection more precise and fixed. Currently the tablet can easily slip off the contacts. Lining up those small contacts is a bit of a pain. Also, there ought to be a way to tell the tablet via ALEXA to totally dim the screen. It's just too bright for use in the bedroom. There also should be a way to customize what you want to see on the home screen.
customer_reviews.author: MRW

customer_reviews.title: Case On!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a case on your product this product is completely useless do to the fact you can not put it on this stand in an after market case. so it really makes no sense to buy this if you are going to have to go on and off with your case to use it,
customer_reviews.author: Cecil of Nc

customer_reviews.title: Not an Echo Show, just a charger.
customer_reviews.text: It worked okay when I received it, then quit charging three weeks later. By the time I was able to attempt a return, I was at Day 31. Though nearly impossible to figure it out (after return window), I was able to order a replacement. It made my Fire imitate the Echo Show, except it cannot be joined to a Group for playing music throughout the house. Also the speaker in the Fire is quite poor. I'm not sure you would want to listen to music through it as a component on your Alexa system.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Great to use in place of echo show
customer_reviews.text: Purchased both a refurbished fire tablet and and a docking station to use in my kitchen instead of an echo show so I can have a bigger screen and it works perfectly, only issue is the speaker system is much better on the echo show compared to speakers on the fire tablet. Ended up connecting a bluetooth speaker to the fire tablet and I have a much better sound set up. So over all I was able to get a larger screen for less than what an echo show would have costed. Recommend this setup to anyone wanting a larger screen.
customer_reviews.author: Audra Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not a good value. Charging is slow and my kindle battery runs down even plugged in. I would not waste money on an expensive stand for my kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Duanes7

customer_reviews.title: Ok, could be so much better
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and steady dock. No issues with the charger like others mentioned. Could of been designed better with kickstand also on the case. I brought down two stars because the Alexa software and os are buggy. Slideshow function doesn't work well, I would like to see my photos rotate, despite changing the options and trying different combinations nothing has worked. It could stay on one photos for an hour and never scrolls continuously. Max photos I seen in an hour was like 5. Slow interface and doesn't already pick up me saying Amazon to activate. I do own two and it serves purpose. It could be so much better, especially at that price
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to get a Fire, get this too.
customer_reviews.text: Having this dock, and the Fire tablet in Show Mode really makes all the difference. This has allowed my tablet to replace my alarm clock. It has also made charging so much nicer. The only drawback that I can see to this is that you cannot use a regular case for the tablet. In my case that doesn't matter. If you have been looking at the Echo Show, just get this and a Fire 8 instead. That's 1 inch more screen space and $100+ cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: It does not allow "drop-in" or reminders or any of the nice features one would regularly use with plain old echo ...
customer_reviews.text: This does not change the tablet to an echo show. It does not allow "drop-in" or reminders or any of the nice features one would regularly use with plain old echo cylinders. I'm seriously considering returning this and just use the folding case I have and run the table plugged in and running show mode (software upgrade). But that may not be possible because Amazon has forced the portrait orientation in such a way that it works correctly with the "show dock connector" but gets vertically inverted with the folding case. Besides that the show dock connector really adds no extra value compared to a plugged in tablet with show mode running constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Partha Sen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for Use with New Colors
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying one of the new Kindle (8HD or 10HD) in one of their vibrant cool colors, think carefully about whether or not you want this. The new show mode dock has one requirement that does not work, at least for me. It requires you snap on this cheap looking, black back plate, which covers the cool sharp new colors. Not what I was expecting nor is it what I want. If you want show mode without covering your cool new colorful Kindle, consider buying just a stand and using show mode with the charger cable and generic stand instead.
customer_reviews.author: John Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Potential Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: This has been a fixture on our countertop for almost two years. Today, I decided to steal the charging cord, because another kindle wasn't charging, so I wanted to troubleshoot the issue with that kindle. When I flipped the base of this over to unplug it, I discovered that the bottom of the housing is cracked, and melted, with some sort of blue film leaking out. I don't know what caused this, but I can't attribute it to any outside forces, so I must conclude that the base overheated while charging, or the internal battery has ruptured. Either way, it's not going back in service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this item.. after a.short period of time your tablet wont work. The sound adjustment buttons are pushing down all the time causing damage to your tablet. So dont waste your money...also Amazon is trying to fix my tablet finally after 3 weeks of calling them. Customer service on this item sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: NOT Wireless Charging
customer_reviews.text: The product description is misleading. This docking station still requires a physical connection to the Micro-USB port in order for it to charge. My Fire HD tablet has a broken Micro-USB port. I bought this docking station thinking I would be able to still charge by simply placing it on the station, much like many other wireless charging devices I own, but that is not the case. It still requires you to physically connect to the micro-usb port on the tablet itself. Very disappointed. Returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Anne Yanko

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be better than my old Fire
customer_reviews.text: It is not better. My games expire I have to re new it. I am working on a Ship we do not have WiFi. I do not have time to try and find a place with WiFI... Not happy I am back to using the Old Kindle... Now my Audio books will not play unless I have access to WiFi... Really!! not every part of this world has WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Michele A. Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly as advertised. Take a kindle tablet and instantly turn it into an Echo Show just by setting it into the stand. It's still a Kindle if you want to read or surf, in or out of the stand. I like that versatility and if you leave it in the stand it's always charged. If you use a Kindle anyway this is an excellent cheap way to own a pricey Show. Turns out it's not really a fully operational show. I ended up replacing it with a Show 5 that except for the smaller screen, I like much better. The speakers on the Kindle suck.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. leeTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Not for an old Parkinson's guy
customer_reviews.text: I found it fairly difficult to use. My daughter, however, had little trouble. You have to line up the tablet somewhat blindly with connections in the charging dock. There's no click when you're aligned properly, no blaring bugles. You hit it or you don't, and mostly I don't. I'm 65, though, and have Parkinson's. So some things aren't easy. So, my daughter is cool with it; me, not so much. I've told you why I think this is true. Take it as you will. As always, a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2. One for my wife and one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.text: My main reason for buying these was because the Kindle fire power plug connector tends to lose its connection after several plugging and unplugging. My daughters old kindle which is less than a year old is now a paperweight as a result I had to buy her a new Kindle Fire. I am hoping these will solve the issue of the plug connector from going bad since these are always plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: My Show Mode Charging Dock worked from 10/27 delivery until 11/15, when I disconnected my Fire 10 to take it on vacation. Upon return, I reconnected the Fire 10 to the dock on 12/1 and the dock will not work. We reconnected it several times to make certain it was connected properly, but it will not charge my Fire 10. I would like a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't charge in the dock.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get the Fire HD 10 to charge when place in the dock and charging stand. No problem when hooked up directly to the charging cable. So I know the problem isn't with the charger. When I put a voltage meter to the two charging points on the charging stand and couldn't detect any voltage. The dock also adds a bit of bulk to the tablet, making it a little less portable. So sending the dock back. Still undecided on whether to keep the Fire HD 10 since I had originally intended to use the table and dock to update my defective clock radio.
customer_reviews.author: softrider

customer_reviews.title: constantly losing her connection
customer_reviews.text: when it works.. it works.. but it constantly is losing her place.. then resets itself... so.. now I spent the money and don't get to use it as intended.. also, when I am not doing anything with it.. it starts automatically playing news and crap... I don't know how many times I asked her nicely to shut up.. stop it.. blabla.. but it just starts spouting out the spammy advertisement news etc... I do not want any of that.. and did not ask it to do that... idk gives me a headache
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire HD 10 Show Mode Charging Dock
customer_reviews.text: Yes. Thank you Amazon. I wanted to buy my Mom a Kindle fire so she should have facebook, solitaire and a few other apps. But she had no way to plug in the USB to charge. This is just too hard for older hands and eyesight. But the Show is a charging dock so she can store it on the dock and it stays charged up. I bought her a 10 inch Fire and she loves it. I love that she has facebook.
customer_reviews.author: SWA_superdisp

customer_reviews.title: Probably the Best Purchase I've Made
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of items via Amazon and have never been happier. The Fire HD 10 is lightweight, BIG, and easily maneuverable. The Alexa built in is a feature I've never really used even when owning the Echo Dot. I've used it to set alarms, timers, and even search for apps. The Fire HD 10 is an amazing device with vivid color and great visibility. The screen does have two downsides, glare and fingerprints are visible as soon as you touch the screen. Nothing a matte screen cover can't fix. All in all, I'm very happy with the Fire HD 10 especially at the low price of $150. Definitely something I'd buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: D Young

customer_reviews.title: Lacking important Alexa functions
customer_reviews.text: Highly misleading product. Do not expect to use your fire tablet as an echo device. It doesn't work with Alexa groups at all. I specifically purchased this dock to use the fire hd 10 as a budget echo show for recipes and music. Don't waste your time. Doesn't integrate with your network of echos, swapping back and forth between show mode is cumbersome. The fire is a slow tablet. It's cheap but that's all it has going for it; sending the tablet and this dock back right away. On the plus side the dock looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: D. Seward

customer_reviews.title: Mixed blessing, stand is nice
customer_reviews.text: I like the stand, but it goes into show mode whenever I replace it in stand which requires exiting to get back to whatever I’m actually doing. I also would like the holder that plugs into the kindle to be more like my kindle cover-protective and easy to transport. Now I am switching it in and out a lot which will wear it out a lot. Let’s face it, modern tech has a limited shelf life anyway, no sense in making it easy to damage. Amazon, you know I will upgrade. I’m on my 5th kindle already .
customer_reviews.author: Useful cynic

customer_reviews.title: connections on the back are very little, magnets in it help with positioning
customer_reviews.text: idea was good, execution of the idea was bad. Very small area for it to "hit the contacts" for it to charge. Other than that, its a dock! what can I say. its at a good angle to see and it does indeed charge fine. but I think a little more thought could have been used in the design. Above was the original review. I've update the review one star because I finally noticed that the stand has magnets that help you find "the sweet spot" to place the tablet in the right position for charging! Which was my biggest gripe! I still think it's a bit pricey but it does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: rac927

customer_reviews.title: Works fine now
customer_reviews.text: I have it near my bed. Takes the place of an alarm clock. Really puts the tablet to use. Edit: 👎👎 downgraded to one star as the alarm function doesn’t work. I’ve contacted Amazon and been waiting patiently for a response that hasn’t come to correct the problem. What a pain in the **s I’ve got to harass them again. Naturally it past the return date 🤬 Updated 11/20/19: well I finally figured our why my alarm wouldn't sound, the thing was in private do not disturb mode ! Duh Only four stars as it can be difficult to line up the charging connections when you cant see what your doing
customer_reviews.author: low profile

customer_reviews.title: Still a bit buggy on the Tablet side
customer_reviews.text: The dock itself is good and haven't had any uses with the device charging. The Show mode on the tablet will not always be available even when it shows it is charging. This is fixed by removing the tablet from the dock and redocking it. Overall, a better solution than getting an actual Echo Show as long as you don't mind the poor sound levels. Would be nice to have a dock version with some Bluetooth speakers built-in to pair the device to. (or USB connected to the Tablet)
customer_reviews.author: Grimor

customer_reviews.title: Hey Alexa, play puppy songs for my Akitas!!
customer_reviews.text: I traded in my beloved 10"HD Fire tablet for the newest version so I could get the bundle with Alexa. I am stoked!! The other day I had to leave the house for a bit, so had to put the babies (my two 6 mos Akitas) into their pens. Generally I turn the tv to DogTV for them so they have some sound to deter them from hearing outside noise that might bother them. Just for fun I said, "Alexa, play puppy songs for my Akitas!" OMG ... a few seconds later, How much is that doggie in the window came on! Amazing. I'm doubly hooked on Fire tablets now!!!
customer_reviews.author: GG, Cro-Quiltin

customer_reviews.title: Micro USB/charging port does not match the tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed when I received this item only to find out the the charging port in this does not even work for the tablet it is made for. I have a Fife HD 10 tablet that I got from Amazon in March and then I bought this item that is supposedly for the tablet I have and yet the charging port is not the same one. I dont know what went wrong here but it was a terrible mistake to get this item. Now I have to go through the hassle of returning it and probably wont try my luck to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beeds a better design.
customer_reviews.text: Over all it is an okay dock if you don't mind not having a full case on your tablet. it does take a long time to charge your table but if used as intended (a dock) you can leave it and forget it. and your tablet will generally be fully charged. Th. charging case does not have a premium feel the edges are sharp making the table uncomfortable to hold. Additionally the bumper corners which I assume are meant to help keep your table safe actually dig in to your hand when holding with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyE

customer_reviews.title: Dock is not fully thought out
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised and disappointed to learn that my new Fire 8", while compatible, was so only by installing a back plate to the tablet. I had bought a carrying type cover at the same time to make it portable when desired, but that's out of use because of the hassle of first removing that backplate. Also this is unusable with Alexa without setting up an external speaker, since the HD8 speakers ARE BLOCKED BY THE BACK PAD! I can barely hear Alexa in a quiet room standing next to it. Nice idea, but I wouldn't have bought it with these shortcomings if I had known.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Sooo close
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think it's a great idea but I believe it missed the boat on one major part. The case that come with the charging dock is easy to connect and use, but if your traveling with your HD Fire you need to disconnect the case and connect a different one to.protect your screen. If only the case that come with it could be in a folio style, it wpuld.eliminate the need for a second case. As well as scratches due to the constant need to change cases. There can also be the opportunity to sell different compatible cases for different customer needs. Just a thought!
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for kindle readers!!
customer_reviews.text: This docking station is your new best friend! It nice to be able to watch movies hands free while it’s charging. It easily & instantly connects to the charging position & is just as easily removable. All you have to do is pick it up. No more plugging it in to charge or worrying that the connection or cord will wear out over time.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Charge even with updated software
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Show Mode only since Christmas and I followed everyones advice and uploaded the newest version of software so the tablet would charge properly. It seemed to work for about a week and then I noticed it was not charging. I have 4 Alexa devices and am very pleased with all of them until I bought the tablet. I like using the tablet and the Show Mode Device only makes sense to have for ease of use but not when you can't charge it. I am very disappointed in this product and would never have bought it if I would have known it was so much trouble. So aggravated with it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Chere' R. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Clunky
customer_reviews.text: The case portion that snaps onto the tablet is too clunky and adds significant weight to the tablet. That wouldn't matter if I only used the tablet in the dock, but I don't; I use my tablet in a variety of locations. I've had a Fire HD8 table for 2.6 years and have long ago figured out a scheme to keep it charged. This dock interfered with that scheme (because once the case is installed, the tablet can only be charged using the dock) and didn't add anything. So, I'm returning the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Budro

customer_reviews.title: It works, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: the big complaint that I have is that it's hard to line up the contacts so that the Fire is actually charging... I have to leave the device on and look for the battery charging indicator, then turn it off from within the dock. If there was a "click" or something that indicated that it was locked, this would be an improvement, as well as if the device didn't come on automatically when docked if it is off (this is a device issue, not an issue with the dock, however).
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Essential Fire Tablet accessory.
customer_reviews.text: This thing adds some much needed versatility to our fire tablet. We use it as a base station in the kitchen so we can use the tablet as a show made base station. My wife loves interacting with Alexa while cooking for news, recipes, and communicating with our Echo Dot network. The wireless charging addition is so useful! Grab the tablet off the base and easily use it as a Kindle reader or web browser. Throw it on the dock for instant charging.
customer_reviews.author: Chat Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works well for an echo show alternative
customer_reviews.text: I use my Fire 8 as a "show" device pretty much 24x7. I had problems with it going in-and-out of show mode on it's own while docked--not once, but over and over again. After messing with it quite a bit, I realized it was the charger. I was using the charger/plug that came with the fire 8 rather than the one that comes with the dock and it's not 100% compatible (my opinion). After switching to the plug that came with the dock, it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It is an outstanding idea, but really, Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: It is an outstanding idea, but really, Amazon, maybe you could tell people that they need to update their Fire HD 8 OS to have "Show Mode"? I spent an hour trying to figure out why the device wouldn't charge when on the dock and then found a post from an outside source stating it required a higher version of the OS than I had installed. Once I updated it worked perfectly. I know it's a new device but maybe a small piece of paper stating "be sure you are on version #"
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so it would charge my eldest daughter's tablet. She had a kindle 7 and ruined it by her repeatedly yanking the cord out of the port, so it screwed the port up on the tablet and wouldn't charge anymore, so I had to purchase her a kindle 8. With this charging dock, we don't have that issue anymore of her yanking the cord out of the port, if she wakes up before I do and she takes this off the dock, it's not a big deal. As for the other things this is supposed to do, I really don't care, I just care that it charges my eldests tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Allen

customer_reviews.title: dOES NOT WORK WELL
customer_reviews.text: I had read reviews after I purchased it. Got my new fire HD10 kindle and docked it, left overnight next morning it was only at 46%. Plugged in charger that came with kindle charged to 100% in an hour. Too bad because I liked the docking station for looking at the kindle. Reviews that I read had the same reasons for not liking it. Wish they would improve it because I would buy another if I had a guarantee it worked with my new Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Lee

customer_reviews.title: Alexa feels more like a novelty than a tool
customer_reviews.text: Alexa works fine. The charging dock makes the tablet convenient. However, you either have to turn the tablet off or mute the speakers when not in use, as it's constantly updaing its on-screen ads (you can also play with assigned sounds for particular events). We could pay some extra cash to remove the ads, but the aforementioned steps seem to work fine. If you want to load non-Amazon apps, check online for instructions. Amazon tries to keep a pretty tight lid on who can install what on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: R2

customer_reviews.title: Not a great alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this (along with an updated tablet) to put a visual Alexa next to the bed...alarm clock, news in the morning, traffic visually...it was a cool concept. Unfortunately, as other reviewers have mentioned, the tablet is not a great Alexa device and adding a heavy back to the tablet does nothing to improve its efficacy. Maybe it will be useful in the kitchen for recipes.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend the show doc and the Fire HD set-up. I have regular Echo Shows, 1st generation which I am pleased with. The doc does hold the Fire HD but the slightest touch will make it fall off. Also the speaker is vastly inferior to the Echo Show and does not work as well for common functions such as an alarm clock. I would recommend spending the additional money for an Echo Show Unless your need the tablet. The Fire HD tablet is heavy and the display is poor compared with competitive products
customer_reviews.author: AZ18

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous improvement for charging
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Show Mode Docking Station, less for the Show Mode and more as an improved charging method for my Fire Tablet. It works wonderfully!!! No more having to gently insert/remove the charging cord. You simply slip the tablet in the docking case, put a clip in the charging port and place it in the docking station. I bought a separate case for transport, but haven't used it. I leave the tablet in the docking station's case all the time. It's s a great improvement for charging 7th and 8th generation Fire Tablets!!!
customer_reviews.author: j.selbo

customer_reviews.title: It just stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Not so long after having it, and I confess that I really liked it, it just sopped working out of the blue. No trauma, no falls, no mistreatments, just stopped working. It is a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L Ferrero A

customer_reviews.title: Why did I give it a three star rating?
customer_reviews.text: I bought my fiancee a Fire HD 10, series 9. The newest version. She loved it, but wanted the charging dock. I ordered one, and it didn't fit. It took me a while, but I realized that it was not for the newest version,. What a crock! You would think they would have updated it so that it work with the newest version. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: EBD

customer_reviews.title: Was great. Was.
customer_reviews.text: The charging case failed. A cheaply made hinged micro USB separated from the case and the ribbon cable kind of came out in such a way that I can’t get it back together. Because I’m months outside of the return, i now have a recipe book stand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws
customer_reviews.text: The design is ridiculous. Case has two TINY connections--TOO small, despite magnets, for it to snap together. It's impossible to tell--no lights or anything--if it's charging or not if the power gets to 0%. The MOST I was able to charge this device was 50%. Mostly it quits at 12%. I bought it because the usual cable connector was defective. It's not helping. I understand from some of the above questions that some sort of update solves the problem.... I will try that next and maybe upgrade review. However, the problem of telling when the dock is charging remains. Why no light? Or anything else?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poor design. The metal contacts on the dock are really easy for kids to touch if you are not watching. And the case is stupid. Theres only one case that is compatible with the dock and it does almost nothing for protection of the tablet. Wouldnt be so bad if there was different case options without making the dock charger useless. Get a better case and the dock joins the rest of the useless objects sitting around that once had a purpose.
customer_reviews.author: cryan.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering purchasing the Show Mode Charging Dock, do it. This product is an awesome value. Over the years, my tablet charging cable has been replaced multiple times. Adding up all the times I've had to replace it, It would have paid for itself. just wish I had known this was available before now. It would have saved me headaches, money, time, and effort. You can't go wrong when you purchase this. You will find it's very easy to set up, and it recharges a tablet rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: Ginnyw

customer_reviews.title: Nice dock
customer_reviews.text: I am so far really liking the Show Mode dock. I am sure I could be using it for more than handy charging station and to talk to Alexa. The only thing I would have suggested is making the tablet case it uses a little more slip resistant. Other than that it is great! It is easy to just grab my tablet and simply sit it back down.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Hillier

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT compatible with a Fire 10, 9th Generation Released in 2019
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Fire 10, 7th generation in October and loved it. Bought this charging dock a few months later, also excellent. Love how it shows pictures, shows recipes, easy to charge, protects the port. Love that it is sturdy. HOWEVER, this charging dock ONLY works with a Fire 10, SEVENTH GENERATION release date of 2017. It does NOT work with a Fire 10, NINTH GENERATION, release date of 2019. We are keeping it because it's still a nice stand for the Fire Tablet and eventually we know there will be a charging dock compatible with the 9th generation.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Uses the only USB Port
customer_reviews.text: This dock seems to work fine as a night stand. However what is not told is that the case that is required to used the dock uses the only mini-USB port. Once installed you must remove the case to use the port. You cannot put another case on the tablet and use the dock. The case requires a little dexterity to remove. If the engineers would have allowed a pass thru USB on the case plug it would greatly enhance this product. I don't want to have to remove the case every time I move the tablet. When I am on the road or in the car it cannot be charged without removing the case. Good idea just poor engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: There is no beauty to this charging unit. The worst issue is the metal plate that must be attached to the tablet (in place of the case). It not only adds considerable weight to the tablet, but must be unattached if you want to use any case. You also still have to deal with a cord on the base unit. And lastly, there is no cover so the screen is always exposed. I'm not impressed. A case and cord will allow the Fire HE 8 to be a light weight, flexible tablet AND still allow the Show More when you want it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Male

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect .. but ...
customer_reviews.text: The magnet or whatever is too weak and I constantly find my device dead from not being perfectly set on the dock. If my cat happens to walk past it he might accidentally move it a hair and then it disconnects and the battery just drains. There is nothing to indicate it isn't charging, unless you constantly check. Also, it takes ages for it to fully charge back to normal. Seriously, this is the most annoying thing to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: mission of mercy

customer_reviews.title: Meah!
customer_reviews.text: The unique utility of just putting the tablet in the stand does not overcome the crummy design. The "case" they supply is slick as whale excrement and very hard to hold onto. I'm not the only one complaining about this. Someone needs to tell the Chinese "designers" the problem. Can't use the tablet without transferring it to a different case. I bought the combo and wish I could return the dock, it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Designed well enough minus sound.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly ingeniusly engineered. Horrible sound, due to the case muffling it. Why not include Bluetooth speakers in the base giving the microphone a wide berth so I don't have the yell "Alexa", over the garbled sound.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R Moyers

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed, even when it did work
customer_reviews.text: Basically an expensive tablet stand. You must attach the heavy cover to use the dock and then remove it when you want to use the tablet or leave it on and deal with the extra weight. It worked on for the first few weeks and then sporadically after that. Was upset to find a dead tablet after being docked for several hours (and yes, I made sure the magnets were aligned). Then it worked again. And then it didn't. After the third time I decided to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rose A.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Awesome idea for my Fire 10. Love the versatility to be able to use it as a show for recipes and alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have.
customer_reviews.text: I like it! The case is just fine, not bulky. The stand is very convenient. I can use it on my lap or on a desk to type easier. Alexa and show mode work just fine. I put the charger on my bedside table at night and place my kindle there. Now, it's fully charged in the morning and not lost, like it used to be. The background screen and displays are not obtrusive, I find them soothing. The magnetic contacts hold firmly and are not difficult to use. I'm glad that I bought this charging stand.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: What disliked was the show mode dock was defective. Called. Customer service and in detail explained the problem since I also purchased a new fire at the same time. The next day an Amazon opened it and there was a new fire which wasn't what I needed. Called the customer service. I requested a call back. Before I could reach the phone customer service called from South Africa. Again explained the problem got it the next day. Show mode and fire work great. Outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This works fine if you were just going to leave the tablet sitting in the dock and never travel with it. Having to swap between this case and a regular case is annoying though. They would have been better off designing a Qi wireless charging sticker to work inside of the regular case and sold a dock with the charger part in the right place to align with it. Ultimately, I went back to the yellow case than stick with this.
customer_reviews.author: RedOneStandingBy

customer_reviews.title: good quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: Like everything, but do not find Alexa very easy to use. Also could not sync blue tooth feature to my blue tooth enabled hearing aids. Watch TV shows, check email & FB, listen to books.
customer_reviews.author: LEM

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Such a remarkable waste of resource and money. If you're looking for a docking station then just buy a cover that sets up your Fire Tablet. This is the second stoopidist thing i've ever done after going to war...OK, and after remarrying. Not returnable. Not repairable. Not supportable from Scamazon.
customer_reviews.author: westyworld

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! I was thinking about buying the Echo Show and had my reservations, but when they came out with this charging dock, it was a no brainer. I went with the higher amount of storage just to ensure that everything would always run smoothly, and it has done just that! This thing is a great baby monitor and great for playing music and looking up cooking recipes. The only thing that would make this perfect, is if it would be compatible with Youtube/Google. Otherwise, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Conway

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge the tablet
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months but now it will not charge the tablet. The tablet charges fine by cord but I bought this because my kid has gone through 5 fire tablets that have ended up with broken USB ports. I thought this was the most bestest, awesomest solution. He received the tablet along with the docking station for Christmas but as of last week it will no longer charge the tablet. Think we are just going to switch over to tablets that can use a surface charger.
customer_reviews.author: KC Red

customer_reviews.title: A little bummed
customer_reviews.text: This does ok. I was disappointed on how well it works to the price. You have to lay it in just right for it to connect. If you bump slightly it disconnects. I have 2 shows, bought one after this. Was hoping i wouldn't need to. If you can't afford the echo show then this is good to do. (Just don't judge this on how good the show actually is.) Mine doesn't always go back to home screen (show homescreen) i have to start it over almost every time. Its not as responsive as it should be. My kindle is pretty new. Just a little bummed.
customer_reviews.author: DAR

customer_reviews.title: One glitch in using the charger
customer_reviews.text: The hard part about using the charger is aligning the charging pins of the charger with the contacts on the back of the Kindle. My advice is to turn on your Kindle first. This will light up the indicators at the bottom of the screen. Then place the center indicator between the pins and you will know that it is properly aligned by the sound the Kindle will make. Easy peasy lemon squeezey.
customer_reviews.author: RLG 2016

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Charge
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is easy to charge. You just set it on the base, but you have to slide it into place to make sure it connects. I like that it sits upright on the base, so you can watch movies on the tablet hands free. I thought the Echo Show Mode functions would be more fun. Kind of a bit of a let down, really. Maybe they will improve Show Mode and make it more exciting to use!
customer_reviews.author: Zleah V

customer_reviews.title: Stick to a charging cable, sadly. 😧
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months, it stopped working last night and drained my tablet to zero overnight. I recharged it again, checked all connections and put it back on the dock where it drained to 47% in 2 hours. A good idea that didn't pan out. Back to a charging cable. It seems to be a Fire related issue as my tablets tend to stop charging after about 18 months and have to be replaced. Great device that's bad for the landfill. And sad because I love them but may need to find another type of similar device made by someone else that doesn't do this. Any recommendations? 😿
customer_reviews.author: G. Faso

customer_reviews.title: nice accessory
customer_reviews.text: This just made my HD10 tablet into a 10in Echo Show. Perfect for showing who is at front door using Blink XT2. I was able to move my original 5in Show to the bedroom and use my tablet as main communicator. After using this for months now and activated the 'wall clock and weather ' app I will never upgrade again. This is a perfect fit in my family room and I have the best of both worlds, a tablet and a 10in Show. Fire tablet 10 using version 7 is the key. Out of 10 stars I will give the two units together a 10.
customer_reviews.author: miami

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Charging - must be poorly constructed internally
customer_reviews.text: Delivered to me on April 30 and stopped working on July 13. After looking deeper this is a more common issue. The cable and charger are fine as the work plugged into the tablet fine. The dock doesn't work anymore. Not much to the device except internal wires which must be defective. Next is to check on warranty.... Stay tuned for an update.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: Show Mode Charging Dock for Fire HD 10 (Compatible with 7th Generation Tablet – 2017 Release)
feature_bullets: Transform your tablet to an immersive, full-screen Alexa experience optimized for visibility across the room. Just ask Alexa to show trending news, timers and alarms, movie showtimes, weather, and more.
Dock your tablet to automatically switch to Show Mode. Enjoy movies, TV shows, books, apps, and games while your tablet is docked—or pick up your tablet to take your entertainment on the go.
Now you can ask Alexa to start a hands-free video or voice call while your tablet is docked, then pick up your tablet to take the call with you.
Stream music from Spotify, Pandora, TuneIn, and iHeartRadio and listen to audiobooks from Audible. Just ask Alexa to play a song, artist, or genre, see lyrics with Amazon Music.
For richer sound, connect your tablet to external speakers via Bluetooth or 3.5 mm audio cable.
Attach the shell to your Fire HD 10 tablet and magnetically dock to the adjustable stand for convenient charging.
Perfect for stationary use, and small enough to place on a kitchen counter, nightstand, or desk.

Includes a shell, adjustable stand, power adapter, and USB cable. Show Mode Charging Dock is compatible with 7th generation (2017 release) Fire HD 10 tablets only. It is not compatible with prior (6th and prior, 2016 release or prior) or newer gen (9th gen, 2019 release) tablets.
